div.sent: Those who love God and have faith in him, receive help from him, and God gives them special power.
In the Bible we see that the Prophets were especially bleased by God.
The second Book of Kings, in Chapter Five, speaks of such a prophet called Elisha who lived in Samaria in the Land of Israel.
He had received special favours from God.
He performed many miracles in the name of God.
We can learn about him by reading Chapters five and six of the Second Book of Kings.
Besides Elisha, there are mentions of many other prophets in the Bible who were given special powers.
This was so because they all had love for God.
They received special powers from God because he was pleased with them.
We marvel at the way they spoke, at their ability to face challenges, at their wisdom and skill in their own profession.
Now listen to the story of how the prophet Elisha cured Naaman who was a leper.
Naaman was a commander in the army of the king of Aram which is situated next to Israel.
Its present name is Syria.
Aram was a rich and powerful nation.
The king of Aram had won many battles with the help of Naaman, a commander in his army.
But this great hero was suffering from leprosy.
Once upon a time, the Aramites conquered Samaria in Israel under the leadership of Naaman.
At the end of the battle, a pretty young girl was carried away from Israel and she was made the servant of Naaman's wife.
The girl was very simple, honest and devoted to work.
Naaman's wife was very pleased with the girl's work and good behavior.
She developed great love and affection for her.
He works many miracles.
I wish that my master could go to the prophet.
He would cure him of his disease.
Namnan's wife believed what the girl told her.
So she told Naaman about Prophet Elisha of Salnaria.
Naaman reported that to the king of Aram.
Go and get ready.
The letter that he took read: This letter will introduce my officer Naaman.
I want you to cure him of his disease.
How can he send this man to me to cure him of his leprosy ?
It's plain that he is trying to start a quarrel with me!
By this time, Elisha heard about this Naaman.
He sent word to the king of Israel saying, Why are you so upset ?
Send Naaman to me.
The king did as he was told to do.
He sent Naaman to Elisha.
Naaman reached the door of Elisha along with his gifts.
But Elisha did not come out of his house.
Elisha meant to let Naaman understand that he had no power of his own to cure him.
It is God who heals.
I could have washed in them and been cured!
I thought that he would at least come out to me, wave his hand over the diseased spot and cure me.
Saying so, he was about to turn around his chariot and leave.
Since people talk so much about the power of Elisha, perhaps if you bath in the River Jordan you can be cured.
So Naaman went down to the Jordan and dipped himself in it seven times.
What a miracle!
At once Naaman was completely cured of his leprosy.
His flesh became firm and healthy, like that of a child.
Then he bowed his head to God in gratitude.
He said to Elisha, Now I know for sure that you are a true servant of the Almighty God.
I will not worship any god except the Lord, the God of Israel.
Forgive me for getting angry with you, and please accept a gift from me.
Elisha replied, I did not cure you by my own power.
It is my God who has cured you.
I am only his servant.
You have been cured because you believed in true God.
Now you can go home in peace.
Serve this God alone in all circumstances of your life and trust in him in all your works.
The Prophet Elisha did not accept any of the gifts that Naaman, the commander of the army, had brought.
Naaman then bade farewell to the Prophet Elisha and returned to his own country rejoicing and thanking the Lord.
He told the king of Aram and all his people about the power of the true God.
We too receive God's mercy and help often and in various ways.
When we pray and perform acts of charity, we receive God's blessings.
We should be grateful to God for all his blessings and praise him for his wonderful deeds.
We should give up sins and shun the way of unjustice.
We should live justly and honestly.
Only then we will find happiness and peace.
Our hearts will be filled with joy that comes from the Lord.
Greed is a kind of sin.
In the Ten Commandments we read, Do not desire what belongs to someone else.
For greed leads man to commit many other sins and evil deeds.
It leads man astray.
Greed destroys peace of mind and brings down sufferings in the personal life as well as in the family.
God does not love a greedy person.
On the contrary God punishes man for his sins of greed.
Now let us listen to the story of Gehazi and what consequences he had to face on account of his greed.
He was pleased to see Naaman being converted and putting his faith in God.
He blessed him and bade him farewell.
When Naaman had gone a short distance, Elisha's servant Gehazi said to himself, How is it!
My master has let Naaman get away without paying a thing!
This cannot be.
So he ran after Navnan to get something from him.
When Naaman saw a man running after him, he got down from his chariot to meet him.
Gehazi walked up to him and greeted him.
They are the disciples of my master Elisha.
He would like you to give them one, talent silver and two changes of fine clothes.
I have been sent to you with this request.
Naaman was very pleased to hear this.
He said, Not one telent, please take two talent silver for the two youths.
Gehazi took the silver and the clothes from them and carried them quietly into his house.
Then he went back to Elisha and stood in front of him as if nothing had happened.
Elisha asked Gehazi, Where have you been?
Gehazi answered, No where, sir.
I was around here.
But Elisha said, Why are you telling, lies?
Wasn't I there in spirit when Naaman got out of his chariot to meet you and gave you silver pieces and clothes?
Didn't I see all this happening?
How greedy you are!
You thought you would buy property and sheep and cattle in exchange for the silver pieces.
Isn't it so?
And now Naaman's disease will come upon you.
As soon as Gehazi went out of the house, he had the disease- his skin was as white as snow.
He suffered from leprosy till the end of his life.
Do you now understand how God punishes those who are greedy and tell lies?
Robin vas the oldest of all and he was very naughty.
In school he was often involved in fights.
He was disobedient to the teachers and inattentive in his studies.
Peter, Sudhir and Chandan follow Robin as their leader.
By the side of the road on which they went to school, was the home of Gedi's mother.
She was a poor old widow.
She used to live there with her daughter Gedi who was also a widow and two little grandchildren.
The house had a thatched roof and looked shabby.
The grand-daughter was about six or seven years old and the grandson was four years old.
The name of the grand-daughter was Nita and the name of the grandson was Pintu.
The family lived hard life on the little money that Gedi earned by working in the neighbor's homes.
On the south side-of their house there was a mango tree and a berry tree.
Last year the mango tree had given lots of fruits.
On their way back home, Robin and his friends stole many of the mangoes.
Gedi's mother raised lots of hue and cry about this and finally she reported it to the teacher.
The headmaster called them in and scolded them saying, You see, Gedi's mother is a poor widow.
You should not steal mangoes from her tree.
You may ask her for one or two, if you wish.
It is a sin to desire and to steal what belongs to someone else.
But a thief does not listen to a pious advice.
They continued to steal mangoes from her tree whenever they got a chance.
They not only steal for themselves, but they also carry away some to their homes.
Gedi's mother reported this to the headmaster and to the parents of Robin, Peter, Sudhir and Chandan.
Their parents also gave them correction and gave them advice not to do such a thing.
This year the berry tree gave lots of fruits.
The berries were quite big and when they were ripe they looked reddish.
Gedi's mother picks the berries on Wednesday and takes it to the market.
She was thinking that she would be able to makes some new dresses for her grandchildren on the occasion of the coming Christmas.
Around two or three in the afternoon, Robin, Peter, Sudhir and Chandan were returning home.
Robin said, Look, the berries are ripe!
We must eat some of it.
Chandan said, No, friend, it is not right to desire what belongs to someone else.
And we should not be stealing.
If we do, we won't be able to escape.
All of a sudden Robin gave a big slap on Chandan's cheek and said, Get list, you hypocrite!
Chandan then went home weeping and wiping his tears.
Sudhir also said, No, friend, I too cannot remain with you.
I am also going with Charidan.
My mother told me it is a sin to steal.
Greed must be checked.
Sudhir also walked away with Chandan.
Robin peeped into the house and saw Gedi's mother sleeping beside her grandchildren.
Slowly he climbed the tree and shook the branches.
Lots of big ripe berries fell on the ground.
Peter who was standing underneath the tree, began to pick up the berries and fill up his bag.
Hearing the noise, Gedi's mother woke up and started shouting saying, Who is there ?
Who is plucking the berries ?
Robin started climbing down the tree in a hurry, but his feet slipped and he fell on a date-tree.
Quite a few thorns from the date-tree penetrated deep into his body.
The neighbours came running and caught him.
Peter started running away and as he ran he tried to jump across a drain.
All of a sudden his feet slipped and he fell down and broke his wrist.
So the neighbour carried Robin and Peter to their homes.
Their parents called in the doctor and treated them for about three months.
It cost them lots of money.
When the headmaster heard what had happened, he issued transfer certificates(T.C.) to Robin and Peter and dropped them from the school.
From this you see, how greed makes one disobey and steal.
And the consequences can be very serious.
God too punishes a greedy and unjust person in some way or the other.
You should take care that you do not become naughty, disobedient and greedy like Robin and Peter.
Never try to do any harm to anyone.
Be kind to the poor.
Otherwise you will be punished like Robin and Peter.
You must learn to control your desire, overcome jealousies and spirit of disobedience.
You must avoid doing what is evil and sinful.
Discipline is a great quality which makes life beautiful.
It helps us overcome many trials and tribulations in life.
And God too showers his blessings upon us.
Help me to overcome all greed, spirit of disobedience and sinful desires.
Create in me a spirit of justice, truth, obedience, faith and devotion which will bring me happiness and peace.
I ask you this through our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.
